channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

  • City: HAYWARD
  • State: CA

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a leaking closure component to a metal tote containing hazardous product, NALCO 5711. XPO was able to tighten the lid and wipe up the 1-ounce release using rags. The tote shipped on to the Consignee and the Consignee accepted the tote.

item.title: Report X-2024121335
item.description:
Report X-2024121335

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-07T00:58:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-20
  • City: EUREKA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 20th a package was found while unloading an inbound vehicle that was partially opened showing the inner contents as 3 cylinders of butane type fuel. An SDS confirmed that this is classified as UN1075 Petroleum gasses, liquefied, 2.1. The package has been secured and is being held in the DG area pending investigation.

item.title: Report X-2024121334
item.description:
Report X-2024121334

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-01T21:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-26
  • City: ONTARIO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE SHIPPED FROM DORAL, FL AND DESTINED FOR HUNTINGTON BEACH, CA WAS DISCOVERED ON 26-DEC-2024 TO BE EXPERIENCING A BATTERY THERMAL EVENT IN A TRAILER AT 2925 E JURUPA STREET IN ONTARIO, CA 91761. THE DISCOVERY OCCURRED DUE TO VISIBLE SMOKE WITHIN THE TRAILER. THE FIRE SELF-EXTINGUISHED, AND BURNED A HOLE IN THE SIDE OF THE PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS, IT WAS DISCOVERED (3) LUMINOUS PRO 2 LED POWER BANKS WERE IN THE PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE POSSESSED NO DG MARKS, LABELS, OR SHIPPING PAPERS DECLARING THE DISCOVERED LITHIUM ION BATTERIES. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING SHIPPER NUMBER H9199D, ACTIVATESWAG, 3200 NW 112TH AVE C4, DORAL FL 33172-5013.

item.title: Report E-2024120438
item.description:
Report E-2024120438

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-01T21:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-26
  • City: FONTANA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0841ET, XPO-USB notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 2 gallons of organic strawberry flavor released from a plastic pail due to improper loading. The release impacted inside trailer#311-2375. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. (1) 15-gallon poly drum contains product and oil dri.

item.title: Report E-2024120436
item.description:
Report E-2024120436

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-01T21:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-26
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0406 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal USA. It was reported that approximately 1-oz of LV650 Clear 2PK released from a metal jug due to a forklift accident. The release impacted concrete dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site.
